Context Class Reference
[Graphics rendering library]

#include <Context.h>

Inheritance diagram for Context:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Base class for platform dependent rendering device contexts.

Manages rendering device state and rendering device dependent resources like textures and vertex buffers.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Context::FilterType

Filtering type for image scaling.

Enumerator:
FILTER_NONE  Filter disabled.

FILTER_POINT  Point filter.

FILTER_LINEAR  Linear filter.

enum Context::OrientationType

Screen orientation.

Enumerator:
ORIENTATION_0  Screen is not rotated.

ORIENTATION_90  Screen is rotated 90 degrees counter-clockwise.

ORIENTATION_180  Screen is rotated 180 degrees counter-clockwise.

ORIENTATION_270  Screen is rotated 270 degrees counter-clockwise.

enum Context::PlatformType

Rendering platform id.

Enumerator:
PLATFORM_DX  Platform is DirectX.

PLATFORM_EGL  Platform is OpenGL ES.

PLATFORM_PSP  Platform is Playstation Portable.

PLATFORM_SW  Platform is software pipeline.

PLATFORM_N3D  Platform is N3D.

PLATFORM_COUNT  Number of platform types.

enum Context::UsageFlags

Resource usage flags.

Enumerator:
USAGE_DEFAULT  Use default options for resource usage.

USAGE_RENDERTARGET  Set for texture that needs to be used as render target.

USAGE_STATIC  Resource is relatively non-changing (not locked every frame).

USAGE_DYNAMIC  Resource is locked frequently (every frame).

Member Function Documentation

virtual void Context::beginScene (  )  [pure virtual]

Called before beginning scene rendering.

Don't use this directly, but exception-safe NS(Context,RenderScene) wrapper instead.

virtual void Context::capture ( const NS(lang, String)&  namefmt  )  [pure virtual]

Captures back buffer contents to a file.

List of supported formats is platform dependent. Currently Win32/DirectX supports BMP, JPG, TGA, PNG, DDS, PPM, DIB, HDR and PFM.

Parameters:
namefmt printf compatible format string of output file name.
Exceptions:
GraphicsException 
IOException 

virtual void Context::clear ( int  color = 0  )  [pure virtual]

Clears viewport on active render target.

Don't need to be called for back buffer since present() takes care of this.

Parameters:
color 32-bit ARGB color

virtual CubeTexture* Context::createCubeTexture ( const NS(lang, String)&  filename  )  [pure virtual]

Creates context dependent cube texture from image file.

Parameters:
filename Image file name.
Exceptions:
IOException 
GraphicsException 

virtual Palette* Context::createPalette ( int  entries  )  [pure virtual]

Creates context dependent palette.

Parameters:
entries Number of entries in the palette. Must be either 16 or 256.
Exceptions:
GraphicsException 

virtual Primitive* Context::createPrimitive ( Primitive::PrimType  prim,
const VertexFormat &  vf,
int  vertices,
int  indices,
UsageFlags  usage = USAGE_STATIC 
) [pure virtual]

Creates context dependent geometry primitive.

Parameters:
prim Primitive type.
vf Geometry vertex format.
vertices Number of vertices.
indices Number of indices.
usage Intended usage. Select USAGE_DYNAMIC if the buffer is locked in every frame. Default is USAGE_STATIC.
Exceptions:
GraphicsException 

virtual Shader* Context::createShader ( const NS(lang, String)&  name,
int  flags = 0 
) [pure virtual]

Creates context dependent shader by name.

Shader name consists of optional path prefix and actual shader name following '/' character. Path prefix is only meaningful if the shader hasn't been used before and if the platform supports external file base shaders. Exact meaning of the shader name is platform dependent, but same names can be used in all platforms.

Parameters:
name Shader name.
flags Compilation flags. See NS(Shader,Flags).
Exceptions:
GraphicsException 

virtual Texture* Context::createTexture ( const NS(lang, String)&  filename  )  [pure virtual]

Creates context dependent texture from image file.

Parameters:
filename Image file name.
Exceptions:
IOException 
GraphicsException 

virtual Texture* Context::createTexture ( int  width,
int  height,
const SurfaceFormat &  fmt,
Palette *  pal,
int  usageflags 
) [pure virtual]

Creates context dependent texture.

Parameters:
width Width of the texture in pixels.
height Height of the texture in pixels.
fmt Pixel format of the texture.
pal Palette if fmt is palettized pixel format.
usageflags Texture usage flags. See UsageFlags.
Exceptions:
GraphicsException 

virtual void Context::endScene (  )  [pure virtual]

Called after scene rendering.

Don't use this directly, but exception-safe NS(Context,RenderScene) wrapper instead.

virtual Primitive* Context::getDynamicPrimitive ( Primitive::PrimType  prim,
const VertexFormat &  vf,
int  vertices,
int  indices 
) [pure virtual]

Gets context dependent dynamic geometry primitive.

Dynamic primitives need to be re-requested always before rendering.

Parameters:
prim Primitive type.
vf Geometry vertex format.
vertices Number of vertices.
indices Number of indices.
Exceptions:
GraphicsException 

virtual OrientationType Context::orientation (  )  const [pure virtual]

Returns screen orientation.

Default is ORIENTATION_0.

virtual void Context::present ( int  color = 0  )  [pure virtual]

Swaps back buffer to screen and clears viewport.

Parameters:
color 32-bit ARGB color

virtual bool Context::ready (  )  [pure virtual]

Returns true if device can be used for rendering.

Call once per frame before using device for rendering.

virtual void Context::setPerspectiveProjection ( float  hfov,
float  front,
float  back,
float  aspect 
) [pure virtual]

Sets perspective projection.

Parameters:
hfov Horizontal field-of-view
front Front/near plane distance
back Back/far plane distance
aspect Viewport aspect ratio (w/h)

virtual void Context::setRenderTarget ( Texture *  dst  )  [pure virtual]

Sets render target.

Render target texture must be created with USAGE_RENDERTARGET flag set.

Parameters:
dst Render target texture or 0 if back buffer should be re-activated.

virtual void Context::setWireframeEnabled ( bool  enabled  )  [virtual]

Sets wireframe rendering enabled/disabled.

Debug usage only. Note that all platform might not support this function (nothing happens).
